title: Development and Evaluation of Three Chatbots for Postpartum Mood and Anxiety Disorders. (arXiv:2308.07407v1 [cs.CL])
abstract: In collaboration with Postpartum Support International (PSI), a non-profit organization dedicated to supporting caregivers with postpartum mood and anxiety disorders, we developed three chatbots to provide context-specific empathetic support to postpartum caregivers, leveraging both rule-based and generative models. We present and evaluate the performance of our chatbots using both machine-based metrics and human-based questionnaires. Overall, our rule-based model achieves the best performance, with outputs that are close to ground truth reference and contain the highest levels of empathy. Human users prefer the rule-based chatbot over the generative chatbot for its context-specific and human-like replies. Our generative chatbot also produced empathetic responses and was described by human users as engaging. translated_title: 《为产后情绪与焦虑障碍开发和评估三个聊天机器人》
translated_abstract: 与产后支持国际（PSI）非盈利组织合作，该组织致力于为产后护理人员提供情绪和焦虑障碍的支持，我们开发了三个聊天机器人，以提供上下文特定的共情支持。我们利用基于规则和生成模型，对我们的聊天机器人的性能进行了评估，并使用机器测量和人类问卷。总体上，我们的基于规则的模型表现最好，输出接近地面真值参考，并且含有最高水平的共情。人类用户更喜欢基于规则的聊天机器人，因为它具有上下文特定的、人类化的回复。我们的生成模型也能产生共情回复，并被人类用户描述为有吸引力。然而，训练数据集的限制常常导致回复混淆或无意义。我们通过讨论基于规则和生成模型的实际好处作出结论。
tldr: 我们开发了三个聊天机器人，为产后护理人员提供上下文特定的共情支持，其中基于规则的模型表现最好，人类用户更喜欢它的回复，生成模型的回复有时混淆或无意义。
